paper.title: Relations Between Time and Tape Complexities

author.org: Cornell University, Ithaca, New York and Bell Telephone Laboratories, Inc., Murray Hill, New Jersey#TAB#
Bell Telephone Laboratories., Incorporated, Murray Hill, New Jersey

paper.abstract: It is shown that if a language L is recognized by a (nondeterministic) single-tape Turing machine of time complexity T ( n ), then L is recognized by a (nondeterministic) offline Turing machine of tape complexity T 1/2 ( n ). If T ( n ) ≥ n 2 ;, L is recognized by a (nondeterministic) single-tape Turing machine of tape complexity T 1/2 ( n ). If a language L is recognized by a (nondeterministic) offline Turing machine of time complexity ( T ( n ), then L is recognized by a (nondeterministic) offline Turing machine of tape complexity ( T ( n ) log n ) 1/2 and by a (nondeterministic) single-tape Turing machine of that tape complexity if T ( n ) ≥ n 2 /log n .
